Package com.xhive.dom.xlink.interfaces

This package contains W3C XLink convenience classes: (1) a utility class with basic link-resolution, link-expansion and link-management functions (2) a DOM XLink API where users can retrieve XLink information from DOM nodes.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
XhiveArcIf Represents an XLink arc.
XhiveExtendedLinkIf Represents an XLink extended link.
XhiveLinkBaseIf Represents an XLink linkbase.
XhiveLinkBehaviourIf Represents XLink behaviour.
XhiveLinkReferenceIf Represents an XLink reference.
XhiveLocatorIf Represents an XLink locator (or remote resource).
XhiveResourceIf Represents an XLink local resource.
XhiveSimpleLinkIf Represents an XLink simple link.
XhiveTitleIf Represents an XLink title.
XhiveXLinkIf Represents an XLink base type.
XhiveXLinkUtilIf Provides convenient link processing methods.
 

Package com.xhive.dom.xlink.interfaces Description

This package contains W3C XLink convenience classes: (1) a utility class with basic link-resolution, link-expansion and link-management functions (2) a DOM XLink API where users can retrieve XLink information from DOM nodes.

Utility class XhiveXLinkUtilIf provides functions to:

  • Transform a node stored in X-Hive/DB to a document address + XPointer expression
  • Retrieve all resources linked by a node
  • Create a document where all embedded links are expanded. Propagate expansion.
  • Link management: detect links and linked resources in collections of documents or parts of documents.

All XLink information is stored in DOM attributes. Therefore the DOM interface already provides access to all XLink information in a DOM tree.
The DOM XLink API provides easier access to this information.

Classes XhiveSimpleLinkIf, XhiveExtendedLinkIf, XhiveArcIf, XhiveLocatorIf, XhiveResourceIf, XhiveTitleIf provide an XLink interface to org.w3c.dom.Element. Class XhiveLinkBaseIf provides an XLink interface to org.w3c.dom.Document.

WARNING: all XLink information must be stored in attributes with the XLink namespace "http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink". If the namespace is not correct, no information is found.
